newsitem.title: CHINA: China eastern province cuts silk reeling machines.
newsitem.headline: China eastern province cuts silk reeling machines.

text.p: China's eastern Zhejiang Province plans to cut the number of silk reeling machines to 35,000 from the current 61,898, an official of the Zhejiang Silk Import and Export Co told Reuters on Wednesday.
Zhejiang is one of the major silk producing provinces in China. The province has reeled about 130,000 tonnes of silkworm cocoons each year for the last five years.
However, silk reeling capacity far exceeds silkworm supply and only 48 percent of silk reeling machines were in use, the official said by telephone.
Among the total 407 silk reeling mills in Zhejiang Province, a few sub-standard ones would be closed, he said.
"Actually, 35,000 silk reeling machines are still surplus to requirements. In any case, we will cut (the numbers) gradually," the official said.

China has implemented a series of measures to stop chaos in the silk industry, banning cocoon speculation among provinces, restricting silk-reeling capacity and gradually raising silk export prices this year.
